channel.title: Physics?
channel.description: I don't know how many of you are into the scientific community, I would hope at least one of you reads up on it. If so, does anyone know anything about M-Theory? I have been studying this recently, as well as Einstein's theory of Relativity.

item.title: Physics?
item.dc:creator: @Xellium Xellium
item.description:
@Xellium wrote:

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:20, topic:442234”][quote author=Aeolian link=topic=544874.msg3997563#msg3997563 date=1337480565]
Unfortunately I don’t think many people here study physics as the average age of the website is pretty young and there is little to no interest in the subject.
[/quote]

I don’t see how people think physics is not interesting. I’m actually a bit excited about taking physics class next semester, but everyone else in my school goes to chemistry. I don’t understand at all.[/quote]

I took chemistry a year early, thinking I would like it. Then, I talked to my chemistry teacher about physics and fell in love with it. Its as if when I read physics, all of my drama’s go away and I only focus on physics.

Read full topic

item.title: Physics?
item.dc:creator: @k_a_h_leader Aeolian
item.description:
@k_a_h_leader wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:19, topic:442234”][quote author=Aeolian link=topic=544874.msg3997563#msg3997563 date=1337480565]
Unfortunately I don’t think many people here study physics as the average age of the website is pretty young and there is little to no interest in the subject.
[/quote]

Well work with the discussion we have…[/quote]

That is the right attitude.

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:20, topic:442234”][quote author=Aeolian link=topic=544874.msg3997563#msg3997563 date=1337480565]
Unfortunately I don’t think many people here study physics as the average age of the website is pretty young and there is little to no interest in the subject.
[/quote]

I don’t see how people think physics is not interesting. I’m actually a bit excited about taking physics class next semester, but everyone else in my school goes to chemistry. I don’t understand at all.[/quote]

I’ve always loved Science in a general subject and anything about it. Physics is just one of those topics that people shy away from because it’s intimidating in the high school/college environment. Same thing goes with chemistry.

Read full topic

Sonoluminescence What causes the emission of short bursts of light from imploding bubbles in a liquid when excited by sound

item.title: Physics?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Xellium, post:15, topic:442234”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=544874.msg3996062#msg3996062 date=1337287714]
I personally don’t think a TOE is possible. There is no ONE equation to solve everything… to many billions of scenarios.
[/quote]

I thought the GUT that leads up to the TOE is just a way to link quantum physics with regular physics.[/quote]

Quantum physics is 99% theoretical, and there happen to be an infinite number of theories out there. I think we have to completely scrap classic physics in order to have any chance at fully understand quantum physics.

Read full topic

item.title: Physics?
item.dc:creator: @Xellium Xellium
item.description:
@Xellium wrote:

reyx7:

The only problem I have with string theory is the consistant need to create dimensions in order for equations to work. Loop quantum physics fixes a lot of these issues, however it works off the big bounce, which I believe to be inaccurate.

I don’t like the standard S-Theory, because to solve many problems in physic’s we need a TOE (Theory of Everything), in order to do that. We need a GUT (Grand Unified Theory), this theory has parts that contradict string theory. Now, M-Theory, I believe it doesn’t screw up GUT. I’m not 100% sure, but I believe I heard that somewhere.

Read full topic

w/e

item.title: Physics?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“frozon566, post:9, topic:442234”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=544874.msg3994663#msg3994663 date=1337113403]

@Kidpaparoach’s sig

quote from: Bebe

The staff reserve the right to interpret these rules any way they see fit. The following rules are more like guidelines. You shouldn’t be looking for loopholes in them, rather, you should just get along with them.

original thread: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,354311.0.html

@op: I read the first few lines from wikipedia and it said its an extension of string-theory, so we should probably start with an understanding of that, which this community of jaba programmers probably doesn’t have since were no Sheldon Cooper.

bbycakes, I’m going to put it quite simply . Moparscape when it comes to rules is worse than a 5 year olds rules… I was just pointing out that its simply very unfair. Also, staff interpretating rules how they see fit does not mean they aren’t repremandable for breaking the rules. I can interpretate the rules how I like and I’ll still get a mute, so Bebes statement was poorly worded. The rules are like guide lines? Well guide lines carry no force, why have people recieved mutes etc then if they are merely guide lines o.o.
And + “shouldn’t be looking for loopholes” is silly, saying people shouldn’t look for flaws with the system is like saying please don’t look at my chest area cause I have nice boobies(i just wanted to say that tbfh, no idea how that ties into what I’m talking about).
[/quote]

to be fair this is all coming from the thread about the kid asking for rep and then the mods jumped in to derep him, david already said in that thread that they were going to reset his rep otherwise anyways.[/quote]
no its not, theres multiple things. the latest one would be tahorak calling a silly person a “retard” along with a rude statement made towards the individual.

Read full topic
